SEARCH
Package com.serezk4.database.service

Class PersonService

java.lang.Object
com.serezk4.database.service.PersonService
All Implemented Interfaces:
PersonRepository
public final class PersonService extends Object implements PersonRepository
Service class for managing Person entities.

The PersonService class implements the PersonRepository interface, providing concrete methods for performing CRUD operations on Person objects. It acts as a bridge between the database and the application, encapsulating the logic required to interact with the persons table.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Handles database queries for retrieving, saving, and deleting Person records.
  • Ensures consistency and error handling during database operations.
  • Maps database results into Person objects.

Design Pattern:

Implements the Singleton design pattern to ensure only one instance of the service exists during the applicationâ€™s lifecycle. Use getInstance() to access the singleton instance.

Usage Example:

 PersonService personService = PersonService.getInstance();
 List<Person> persons = personService.findAll();
 Optional<Person> savedPerson = personService.save(new Person(...));
 personService.removeById(1);
Since:
1.0

  • Constructor Details

    • PersonService

      private PersonService()
      Constructs the PersonService.

      This private constructor enforces the Singleton pattern, ensuring that only one instance of the PersonService exists during the application's lifecycle. Direct instantiation is prevented to centralize data access logic.

      Use getInstance() to obtain the singleton instance.

      Design considerations:

      • Encapsulates all Person database operations in a single service.
      • Reduces redundancy and centralizes database access logic.
      See Also:
      • getInstance()
      • PersonRepository

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static PersonService getInstance()
      Provides the singleton instance of the PersonService.

      If the instance is null, a new PersonService is created. Subsequent calls to this method will return the same instance. This ensures consistent access to shared resources, such as database connections.

      Usage Example:

       PersonService personService = PersonService.getInstance();

      Thread Safety:

      This method is not inherently thread-safe. Ensure external synchronization if used in a multi-threaded environment.

      Returns:
      the singleton instance of the PersonService.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if initialization fails due to unexpected errors.
      See Also:
      • PersonService
      • PersonRepository

    • findAll

      public List<Person> findAll()
      Retrieves all Person records from the database.

      This method executes the PersonQuery.FIND_ALL SQL query to fetch all rows from the persons table. Each row is mapped to a Person object using the map(ResultSet) method. If an SQL error occurs during execution, an empty list is returned, and the error is logged.

      Thread Safety:

      This method uses a single database connection and is not thread-safe. External synchronization is required for concurrent access.

      Performance Considerations:

      • Large datasets may impact performance; consider using pagination for scalable solutions.
      • Efficiently processes ResultSet to reduce memory overhead.
      Specified by:
      findAll in interface PersonRepository
      Returns:
      a List of all Person entities, or an empty list if none are found or if an error occurs.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if mapping errors occur during result processing.
      See Also:
      • Person
      • PersonQuery.FIND_ALL
      • map(ResultSet)

    • save

      public Optional<Person> save(Person person)
      Saves a Person entity to the database.

      This method executes the PersonQuery.SAVE_PERSON SQL query to insert a new Person into the persons table. All attributes of the Person are set as parameters in the query. Upon successful insertion, the database-generated ID is retrieved and assigned to the Person object.

      Thread Safety:

      This method is not thread-safe and assumes single-threaded usage. For concurrent applications, external synchronization is recommended.

      Failure Handling:

      • Returns an empty Optional if the save operation fails.
      • Logs detailed error messages for debugging and monitoring.
      Specified by:
      save in interface PersonRepository
      Parameters:
      person - the Person entity to save.
      Returns:
      an Optional containing the saved Person, or an empty Optional if the operation fails.
      See Also:
      • Person
      • PersonQuery.SAVE_PERSON

    • removeById

      public void removeById(int id)
      Deletes a Person entity from the database by its unique ID.

      This method executes the PersonQuery.REMOVE_BY_ID SQL query to remove a record from the persons table. If the specified ID does not exist, no action is performed.

      Failure Handling:

      • Logs detailed error messages if the operation fails due to SQL exceptions.
      Specified by:
      removeById in interface PersonRepository
      Parameters:
      id - the unique identifier of the Person to delete.
      See Also:
      • Person
      • PersonQuery.REMOVE_BY_ID

    • map

      private Optional<Person> map(ResultSet result) throws SQLException
      Maps a ResultSet row to a Person entity.

      This method extracts data from the specified ResultSet and creates a Person object. Complex fields such as Coordinates, Location, and enumerations like Color and Country are also populated.

      Error Handling:

      • Returns an empty Optional if the ResultSet is empty.
      • Throws a SQLException if errors occur while reading data.
      Parameters:
      result - the ResultSet containing data to map.
      Returns:
      an Optional containing the mapped Person, or an empty Optional if the ResultSet is empty.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if an error occurs during data extraction.
      See Also:
      • Person
      • ResultSet
